page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: Most of this area is farm-land, mainly growing cereals and rough grazing for sheep and cattle. There is an extensive system of drainage dykes which take the rain water away from the very flat, low lying land in the North and East of the area. The land rises slightly to the West and the villages of Alvingham and North Cockerington are built on this higher ground. The "Louth Navigation" canal runs through the area, deviding the two villages, as does the River Lud. Alvingham is the older and larger of the two settlements, its unique feature being the{two}churches in{one} church-yard.
